model.BoardPack

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.BoardPack.Board
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DynamicBoard, StaticBoard

    public abstract class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    The Board class uses and creates byte arrays of 1's and 0's (boardArray). Then a neighBour array is created (neighBoard) from the boardArray which counts how many 1's each cell has as a neighbor. Then the method nextGeneration can be run, which sends boardArray and the neighBoard array through the Rules.rleRules() method from the rule class, which changes each 1 and 0 to a different value according to the applyRuleset in the Rule class. Then the boardArray is run through the draw method to be placed on the canvas of the FXML-file.
    See Also:
    Rule, DynamicBoard, StaticBoard

    • Method Detail

      • setNextGeneration

        public void setNextGeneration()
        Generation logic consists mainly of three parts(methods). Firstly the updateNeighBoard which checks the BoardArray for alive cells and then for each alive cells uses the countNeighBhours method to add +1 to each of neighbouring cells in the neighBoard, byte[][]. Then then the setNewGenValues() method checks if cells are alive or dead and passes the status and its neighbour value to Rule.rleRules and gets back the new status of the cells. Which is now the new values of the BoardArray.
        See Also:
        setNewGenValues(), countNeighbhours(int row, int col), neighBoard, Rule.rleRules(int cellState, int numOfNeighbhours)

      • beforeSetGeneration

        public void beforeSetGeneration()
        Prepares the Board for the generation logic. This is done by: resetting the aliveCells, creating an empty board to contain the neighbors all the cells with createNeighBoard and then increasing the number of iterations.
        See Also:
        createNeighBoard()

      • updateNeighbourBoard

        public abstract void updateNeighbourBoard()
        Creates an array containing the number of neighbors for each cell. The array containing information about the number of neighbors is used to calculate the next generation of the main board (boardArray).

      • setNewGenValues

        public abstract void setNewGenValues()
        Changes the current boardArray to its nextGenaration by placing new values into the boardArray. Comparing the neighBoard with its corresponding boarArray cell state. Then using the Rules.rleRules() to determine the new state of the cells.
        See Also:
        Rule.rleRules(int, int)

      • countNeighbhours

        public abstract void countNeighbhours(int row,
                                      int col)
        Adds +1 to all cells in the neighboring cell of an alive cell. This in the end determines how many neighboring alive cell each cell has.
        Parameters:
        row - index
        col - index

      • getNeighBoard

        public byte[][] getNeighBoard()
        Gets the byte[][] containing the number of neighbors to all the cells.
        Returns:
        neighBoard the byte[][] with the number of neighbors of the corresponding cells

      • createNeighBoard

        public abstract void createNeighBoard()
        Creates a new blank neighBoard with the same height and width as the main board. This is later updated with the number of neighbors to each cell.

      • setOptimaliser

        public void setOptimaliser(boolean optimaliser)
        Sets the value for the optimaliser.
        Parameters:
        optimaliser - the boolean to assign (true if active)

      • sizeTest

        public abstract void sizeTest()
        Checks if dimensions of the boardArray exceeds a certain limit. If the provided limit (in this case, 2000) is exceeded, the outer rows and columns are set to 0 to limit the dimensions of the boardArray to the given constant (in this case, 2000).
        See Also:
        DynamicBoard.boardArray

      • addArrayToBoard

        public abstract void addArrayToBoard(byte[][] array)
        Adds a new byte[][] to the board. The array is added onto the existing boardArray.
        Parameters:
        array - the byte[][] to add

      • setCellValue

        public abstract void setCellValue(int row,
                                  int col,
                                  boolean erase,
                                  int maxSize)
        Alters the cell state of a specific cell, identified by row and col. The erase determines if the alteration should be 0 into 1 (false) or 1 into 0 (true). If row or col is outside of the bounds of the boardArray, rows or columns are added at the side of the boardArray which is selected.
        Parameters:
        row - the row of the current cell
        col - the column of the current cell
        erase - erases (1 into 0) if true or draws (0 into 1) if false
        maxSize - when the Board will no longer expand on mouseclick.

      • getBoundingBox

        public abstract int[] getBoundingBox()
        Used to "compress" the board to fit to where there are alive cells.
        Returns:
        an array which describes outer edges of the board where there a alive cells.
